Description: Pottery ostracon consisting of two joining fragmens and containing a religious composition, or canticle in Greek. This is followed by the beginning of a letter in Coptic from Dioskoros.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.22, pl.17)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (65437) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/65437)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Gr. I 17:1 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2012)
